intro: Hieracium pilosella subsp. trichoscapum, commonly known as the hairy hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a flat-topped cluster, typical of the daisy family. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in meadows and grasslands. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it can become invasive in certain environments.
